node.title: DAY 3
node.excerpt:
Earth, Wind and Storm Antonio The day started with Dee following Bowie’s example of yesterday arriving ten minutes late at the departure point to the sound of a berating Monkey. Off the trio set up the steep climb out of Zennor, halfway up the hill on a blind left hand bend Dee’s steed Buttercup decided …

node.title: DAY 2
node.excerpt:
Time, Accidents and U Turns  This morning our Time Lord threw us a curved ball by being a full ten minutes early for the allocated breakfast slot. As we ate breakfast at exactly 0840 Bowie requested a departure time, our initial suggested time of 0837 was rejected as was 0859. We finally settled on 0901, …

node.title: DAY 1
node.excerpt:
Heading South with Harassment  At 0702 Dee arrived in the loaded van to collect Bowie deliberately and strategically two minutes late to fluster the time lord. After which Monkey was picked up a quick stop at Greggs Denton Holme and the riders headed south on the M6. With Dee driving to the M6 toll services …

node.title: D Day minus one
node.excerpt:
Suspense, spares and packing. Tomorrow at 0700 the three disturbed cavaliers embark on leg three, the final stage of the circumnavigation of the UK on the 50 Cubs. Check list – Daily blogs will follow, after traveling to the leg two finish point in Exeter tomorrow we unload the cubs and ride 75 miles to …

node.title: DAY EIGHT
node.excerpt:
The journey home After the late finish on the final day the team dined in the accommodation and had a few refreshments before retiring thoroughly exhausted. After breakfast at eight the boys departed on the cubs to do the seven mile ride to Enterprise van rental. This route was not programmed in Monkeynav and so …

node.title: DAY SEVEN
node.excerpt:
Envy, The Isle of Wet, Grandparents, Westward bound and journeys end. The previous evening saw the trio after a few well earned beers encamped in an Indian restaurant. Irritatingly despite pleas Monkey yet again karate chopped the poppadoms, Dee bided his time  and pounced on Monkeys after eight post meal mint crushing it in its packet. …

node.title: DAY SIX
node.excerpt:
Dissatisfactions, directions and delight. Last night the trio decided Italian food was the order of the day and were recommended the Tricolour in Ramsgate. Off they set on foot, sadly no tables were available being a popular place on a Saturday night. Dee and monkey suggested the Indian we passed on the way, but Bowie …

node.excerpt:
SKA, SPITFIRES AND TEACUPS The trio walked down hill last night to a Thai restaurant for sustenance, on the way they past a working man’s club and heard the sounds of a band warming up. After dinner we trudged back up the mountain Bowie had taken us down arriving at the club which now looked …

node.title: DAY FOUR
node.excerpt:
MEMORY LOSS, BYWAYS, GAMES AND WACKY RACES Last night saw the team bedded in the Lord Kitchener in Lowestoft, a splendid military veterans themed pub run by a friend of Bob Monkeys brother. The hospitality and donations from the venue were superb. We were taken out by Bob and his extended family to a beachfront …

node.title: DAY THREE
node.excerpt:
FEDS, TRACTORS, ARTILLERY PIECES AND ANTS. The team were excellently fed and watered by the staff and customers of The Carpenters in Boston. Also both the landlady and many customers sponsored our mission for which were deeply grateful. During the evening Dee and Bowie enjoyed several orange gins Avec raised pinky’s, not to be outdone …
